It's made by Kita-boshi, a small family owned pencil company in Japan. Kita-boshi is not only known for their pencils but also for recycling the by-products of pencil making for other innovative products and for their commitment to sustainability and education. It's pigmented and easy to write with but can also be wiped away with water. Made in Germany Grade: n/a Measures: 7" long Sold individually Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter

pencils.title: Alpha 245 Jumbo Pencil
pencils.description: A hefty mid-century jumbo by one of America's most legendary pencil makers. We love this pencil especially for its type. Vintage: Unknown, likely 1950s/1960s Made in the USA Measures 7" long Round barrel Please note that all vintage pencils may have minor flaws due to age and that you can expect the erasers to not work anymore. pencils.title: Anthracite Perfect Pencil Magnum
pencils.description: The Graf von Faber-Castell Perfect Pencil is the most luxurious and complete pencil experience. The fluted California cedar pencil comes with a capped eraser on one end, and a combination point-protector, pocket clip, and sharpener on the other. Both the pencil and the eraser can be replaced (keep in mind that the cap will only fit on Graf von Faber-Castell pencil refills). The high-quality graphite and anthracite PVD coated titanium hardware make this the Perfect tool for those who write, draw, or simply enjoy fine analog tools. This particular version is a jumbo version of F-C's original Perfect Pencil and features an extra thick 2B lead. Prior to the 20th century, the famous pencil firm went by the name A.W Faber until heiress Baroness Ottilie von Faber married Count Alexander zu Castell-Rüdenhausen. They legally changed their last names to Faber-Castell in order to use it as the new name for the family business. The Graf von Faber-Castell line (translated literally as the Count of Faber-Castell) celebrates the tradition and history of this esteemed company. Made in Germany Measures 6 inches assembled Pencil measures 5 1/4 inches Cap measures 3 inches Sold individually This set comes with 1 pencil. You can find the appropriately sized refills here. Please note that this only fits GvF Magnum pencils.

pencils.title: Archer Limited Edition Elements Pencil
pencils.description: This very special pencil is a collaboration between Baron Fig (the makers of our favorite notebook for pencil) and me (Caroline Weaver, otherwise known as CW). It's a simple ode to the things that the pencil is actually made of--graphite, clay and water for the core, wood for the barrel, paint and foil for the finishing. The pencil features a graphite-grey dip with tiny drawing of all six of these elements. Made by our friends at Baron Fig Made in Portugal Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7" long Sold as a tube of 12 pencils Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. pencils.title: Art Graf Soft Carbon Water-soluble Pencil
pencils.description: This a pencil we're always proud to talk about because it's unique in a number of ways. The core is exceptionally thick and is very very black. It almost looks like charcoal on paper but is heavier, less messy and feels a bit sticky to use. Really, though, the best part is that it's water-soluble. Take a paintbrush to it and you'll find that it begins to resemble Indian ink. For the artistically inclined, it's a must-have. Viarco is Portugal's one and only pencil factory. Founded in 1907, Viarco has done a beautiful job of preserving and sharing their Portuguese while also constantly innovating unique new things. They are very much a 21st century pencil company. Made in Portugal Grade: Ungraded Measures 7" long Sold individually Round barrel, normal diameter We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. pencils.description: Meet your scorebook's new best friend! It's made for us by General Pencil Company, which was founded in Jersey City, New Jersey in 1889. Baseball scoring is one of the few 21st century activities still done mostly in pencil, so we thought we'd make something specifically for it. Designed for optimal comfort and efficiency, it features a round barrel, a soft eraser and a core that is dark, smooth and cased in cedar. It's dark enough to show up on glossy scorecards and smudge-proof enough for toothy card stock too. **If you want your pencils in the box, please be sure to select "Box of Six" not 6 individual pencils.** Made in the USA Grade: feels like a B/#1 Measures 7 1/2" long Round barrel, normal diameter Sold individually OR in a box of six Pre-sharpened

pencils.title: Blackwing 602 Pencils (Dozen)
pencils.description: The classic! This pencil was made famous by the smoothness of its graphite, its unique eraser clamp and the famous faces who wrote with it. Here we have a reproduction made by Palomino, and it's pretty darn close to the original. The Blackwing 602 was originally made by Eberhard Faber in New York. It was introduced in the early 20th century and was lauded for the uniqueness of its design and its quality as a writing pencil. When Eberhard Faber was sold in 1988 the Blackwing survived for only a couple of years before it was discontinued. Luckily, Palomino acquired the rights to the pencil only a couple of decades later and brought the legacy of the Blackwing 602 to light for a new generation of pencil users. Made in Japan from California cedar Grade: Ungraded, but looks and feels like a 2B Replacement erasers are available here Each pencil measures 8" long Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Sold by the dozen We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. The swatch in this product listing reflects that.

pencils.title: Blackwing Volume 10001 Pencils
pencils.description: The Summer 2018 Blackwing Volumes release is naturally beautiful, features a unique pentagonal shape and has a particularly interesting background story. As the box reads: "When Tetsuya Miyamoto invented the KenKen® puzzle in his mathematics classroom in 2004, his goal was to improve his students’ problem solving and logic skills. He describes his method as “The Art of Teaching without Teaching,” and his dream is to make the world smarter with his invention. Today, the KenKen® puzzle is the only puzzle printed daily alongside the New York Times Crossword. Puzzles like these inspire us to apply problem solving and logic in creative ways, letting our minds perform a beautiful dance between their left and right hemispheres. Blackwing 10001 (壱万壱) pays tribute to Miyamoto Sensei’s puzzles and other creative ways of teaching and learning. 10001 is a numeral palindrome in Kanji as well as in Arabic numerals. It is also tied to one of Miyamoto Sensei’s favorite equations. The pencil features a red stained barrel, gold imprint and unique five-sided “Gōkaku pencil” shape. Translated literally from Japanese, Gōkaku means “passed,” as in a problem or exam. It is also a near-homophone for the Japanese word “Gokakukei,” meaning pentagon. Gōkaku pencils are given to every student who graduates from the Miyamoto Mathematics class." Made in Japan from California cedar Grade: Ungraded but feels a B or even a 2B (same hardness as a Blackwing 602) Replacement erasers are available here Each pencil measures 8" long Pentagonal barrel, normal diameter Sold by the dozen

pencils.title: Blackwing Volume 33 1/3 Pencil - Dozen
pencils.description: The autumn edition of the ever-popular Blackwing Volumes series is a tribute to another popular analog relic: the vinyl record! Here's the story, from the source: " From their introduction in the late 1800s, analog records have withstood the advent of radio, the rise and fall of CDs and MP3s, and the dawn of streaming. Rather than be displaced by these more convenient ways of consuming music, the vinyl record has instead shifted from an object of convenience to one of connection. And it has thrived in the process. Just as the way we engage with pencils and notebooks is different from the way we interact with keyboards and touch screens, the way we engage with records is different from the way we interact with digital music. From the rich, uncompressed sound to the album art and liner notes, records tell a story both physically and sonically. According to music icon Henry Rollins, of all the ways to listen to music, “vinyl [best] represents what the musicians wanted you to hear.” The vinyl experience not only creates a physical and emotional connection between music and people, it creates a connection between musicians and their fans. The Blackwing 33 1/3 is a tribute to vinyl records. It features a matte black finish and matte black ferrule to go with its black imprint and black eraser. The gloss black foil banding near the grip was inspired by the grooves on a record." Made in Japan from California cedar Grade: Ungraded but feels like a 2B (the same core as the Blackwing Pearl) Replacement erasers are available here Each pencil measures 8" long Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Sold by the dozen

pencils.title: Blackwing Volume 4 Pencil - Dozen
pencils.description: Meet the winter 2018/2019 edition of the Blackwing Volumes series! This one has a unique texture, a colored ferrule and a great story, straight from the source: "In 2020, NASA will send a rover to Mars to search for evidence of ancient Martian life while testing technologies for future human expeditions. While the engineering designs for the rover and its various instruments are finalized in CAD, its revolutionary robotic arm and zoom-enabled cameras – the first of their kind to be sent to another planet – were first conceptualized in drawings by the team at Motiv Space Systems using Blackwing pencils. Earlier this year, Motiv delivered their assemblies based on these drawings to begin integration onto the rover. In 2020, they will join the Wright brothers’ wrapping paper sketches and Katherine Johnson’s brilliant calculations as examples of the pencil’s ability to help us reach the sky, space and beyond. The Blackwing 4 is a tribute to Mars and the upcoming rover mission. It features a rust-colored lacquer and sand-textured finish inspired by the surface of the fourth planet. It also features our first ever bronze ferrule, a cream imprint and eraser, and our soft graphite." Made in Japan from California cedar Grade: Ungraded but feels like a 3B-ish (the same core as the black Blackwing) Replacement erasers are available here Each pencil measures 8" long Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Sold by the dozen

pencils.description: The Bugle is as simple as they come with its minimally finished barrel and solid #2 graphite core. Round pencils tend to be hard to come by these days and this pencil is not only round but is also reminiscent of the round, unfinished pencils once made by John Thoreau and his son Henry David (yes, that Henry David Thoreau). Musgrave Pencil Company is based in Shelbyville, TN and was founded in 1916 during the heyday of the American pencil industry. The pencils they make today feature especially nostalgic designs, many of which have remained unchanged for many decades. Made in the USA Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7" long Sold individually Round Barrel, normal diameter We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. The swatch in this product listing reflects that.

Prior to the 20th century, the famous pencil firm went by the name A.W Faber until heiress Baroness Ottilie von Faber married Count Alexander zu Castell-Rüdenhausen. They legally changed their last names to Faber-Castell in order to use it as the new name for the family business. The Castell 9000 is the hallmark of the pencil giant's shift into a new century. Made in Germany Grade: #2/HB, runs hard, feels more like an F or H. pencils.description: Faber-Castell's flagship drawing pencil, the Castell 9000 has been worldwide staple since its launch in 1905. It's a very traditional, well-made German pencil, one that has set the standard for what a quality pencil should be. Prior to the 20th century, the famous pencil firm went by the name A.W Faber until heiress Baroness Ottilie von Faber married Count Alexander zu Castell-Rüdenhausen. They legally changed their last names to Faber-Castell in order to use it as the new name for the family business. The Castell 9000 is the hallmark of the pencil giant's shift into a new century. Made in Germany Grade: #2/HB, runs hard, feels more like an F or H. Measures 7" long Sold individually Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Pre-sharpened We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. The swatch in this product listing reflects that.

Family-owned General Pencil Company has been making pencils in Jersey City, NJ since 1889 and is one of only three pencil companies still left in the United States. All of their pencils are made of high quality California incense cedar and are made to as high a standard as they were 100 years ago. Made in Switzerland Sold individually The fixpencil comes with one full length lead. Refill leads are sold separately and can be found here.

pencils.title: Futura #2 Pencil
pencils.description: As far as vintage pencils go, there's one that always at the top of our eBay wish list. The Futura was first made in the 1950s by Richard Best Pencil Company--the same pencil company that made the first triangular pencil, the Try-Rex. The Futura was their snazzy pink version of their flagship pencil, with its wonderful typography and often flashy ferrule. The Futura existed in a few slightly different forms during its existence and is still a highly sought after vintage. Somewhere along the line J.R Moon of Lewisburg, Tennessee acquired the rights to the Try-Rex and the rest of Richard Best's companies so we approached them about bringing our favorite Futura back in a modern way. Though the ability to do a super custom ferrule is limited these days and the odd shaped printing plate necessary for the beveled ages is just short of impossible, we hope you enjoy our 2017 version of this glossy pink beauty. Made in the USA Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7 1/2" long Sold individually Triangular barrel, normal diameter We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. As Mitsu-bishi's standard writing pencil (officially designated for 'General Writing'), this green beauty has terrific point retention and a well finished end. In the first half of the 20th century, Japanese pencils were labeled with their intended use because of regulations set to monitor the prices pencils were being sold for. Pencils designated for certain uses were meant to have certain characteristics and qualities that were consistent with other brands and reflected in their price. Though this isn't used anymore, the inclusion of the designations is still included in most pencil designs. pencils.description: This pencil is a nostalgic but currently manufactured version of the classic American yellow #2. Family-owned General Pencil Company has been making pencils in Jersey City, NJ since 1889 and is one of only three pencil companies still left in the United States. All of their pencils are made of high quality California incense cedar and are made to as high a standard as they were 100 years ago. The Goddess is a rare version of a still-made round pencil. Though difficult to find (especially with an attached eraser), round pencils are often a bit more comfortable to hold than their hexagonal counterparts. Made in the USA Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7 1/2" long Sold individually Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Pre-sharpened We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. The swatch in this product listing reflects that.

If you have a preference please write it in the 'notes' field at checkout and we will do our best to accommodate it. pencils.title: Goldfish Autocrat 5000 #2 1/2 Pencil
pencils.description: The Goldfish Autocrat comes from Shahsons, Pakistan’s first pencil factory, founded in 1952. Originally sandalwood scented, this has always been the company’s flagship pencil. Though they’re no longer fragranced, the Goldfish is so famous that asking for a “scented pencil” at any stationery store in Pakistan will still result in one of these brown and gold HBs. And the name? It’s proof that not all pencil mistakes are worth erasing: the pencil was supposed to be called “Goldfish Aristocrat,” but was mistakenly printed “Autocrat.” Either way, we think it rules. Made in Pakistan Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7" long Sold individually Pre-sharpened Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. The swatch in this product listing reflects that.

pencils.title: Grip 2001 Black Pencil - HB
pencils.description: A favorite of many pencil enthusiasts, the Grip 2001 won a slew of design awards when it was first introduced in 2001 for its triangular shape and patented Soft-GRIP zone. Little dots speckle the barrel of the pencil so your fingers won't slip and your hand won't feel fatigued while writing for extended periods of time. The pencil is made of Jelutong, a lightweight, easy to sharpen Indonesian wood and its graphite writes smoothly and retains its point very well. This particular version features an all-black design and wood that has been dyed to match. pencils.title: Hardtmuth 1500 Pencil - 2B
pencils.description: In 1889, the Koh-i-Noor 1500 pencil made its grand debut at the World's Fair in Paris. At this moment in history most radical innovations debuted similarly but for the pencil industry this was especially monumental. Not only was the 1500 the first pencil to be painted yellow but it was also the first pencil to be deliberately painted as a design choice. Painting a pencil normally signified that the pencil was imperfect and there was something to hide so makers of high quality pencils opted to leave them unpainted to show of the wood grain. Originally the ends were dipped in 24ct gold, they came in an unheard of 17 grades and were sold for at least three times that of comparable pencils of its time. Over a century later, the Koh-i-Noor Hardtmuth 1500 is still manufactured similarly to how it was in the 1880s and represents an undeniably important moment in pencil history. Made in the Czech Republic Grade: 2B but feels more like a B or an HB Measures 7" long Sold individually Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Pre-sharpened We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. The swatch in this product listing reflects that.

pencils.title: Mephisto 73B Copying Pencil - Hard
pencils.description: The copying pencil is an excellent example of a specialty pencil from a bygone era. It was originally made to contain vibrant purple aniline dye, so that it could be used for permanent marking and also to be transferrable when wet. The height of its popularity was in the very early 1900s when it served as an easy, permanent writing tool and as a way to copy documents. The Mephisto was one of the most popular models in the US during this era--this version is a purple of with a hard lead, which is generally preferable for copying pencils. Note: since this pencil was produced, aniline dye has been found to be quite toxic. It's absolutely safe to use the pencil for its intended purpose, just be sure you don't ingest it. pencils.title: Original Blackwing 602 - 1940s
pencils.description: The one, the only, the Eberhard Faber Blackwing 602! One of the most sought-after and collectable pencils in history, the 602 is legendary for its flat ferrule, removable eraser, extra smooth core and for the slew of iconic writers who used it. Whether you keep it or sharpen it up, it's a pencil every collection needs. This particular one is a very early version of the Blackwing 602 Pencil. Notably, the type is different on this version than on later ones and the pencil itself is a little shorter. Vintage: late 1950s/early 1960s Made in the USA Measures 7 3/4" long Hexagonal barrel *Box not included Please note that all vintage pencils may have minor flaws due to age and that you can expect the erasers to not work anymore. The pencil you will receive will not necessarily be the one in the photo but definitely one from the same dozen. We've tried our best to accurately capture the quality of the pencil and promise not to sell you something of lesser quality. For Blackwings especially, the ferrules were rarely put on straight. Please do not be alarmed if your ferrule isn't aligned with the text, it won't affect the function or value of the pencil.

pencils.title: Potent Copying 749 Pencil
pencils.description: The copying pencil is an excellent example of a specialty pencil from a bygone era. It was originally made to contain vibrant purple aniline dye, so that it could be used for permanent marking and also to be transferrable when wet. The height of its popularity was in the very early 1900s when it served as an easy, permanent writing tool and as a way to copy documents. This later example comes with its own little cap to prevent an inky mess and contains red dye. According to the text on the back of the pencil, it's meant "for hectograph use". Note: since this pencil was produced, aniline dye has been found to be quite toxic. It's absolutely safe to use the pencil for its intended purpose, just be sure you don't ingest it. It's made by Kita-boshi, a small family owned pencil company in Japan. Kita-boshi is not only known for their pencils but also for recycling the by-products of pencil making for other innovative products and for their commitment to sustainability and education. Made in Japan Core: a firm but pigmented red Measures 7" long Sold individually Round barrel, normal diameter

pencils.title: Red Needle-Point 7700 Pencil
pencils.description: In 2015 Mitsubishi Pencil Co. announced that they would be discontinuing their 7700 range of colored pencils, which they’d been making since 1971. The pencils only came in 12 colors and were renowned for being the favorite colored pencil among animators and architects in Japan. Their hard, highly pigmented lead was preferred to fine line drawing. Panic ensued and stores very quickly sold out of every color. Within 24 hours, Mitsubishi decided to continue making the four most popular colors: red, orange, yellow-green and light blue. Here you’ll find the red version, the most coveted of them all. Whether you’re grading papers, sketching around or making a master plan, it’s an excellent addition to your pencil arsenal. Made in Japan Core: A hard but pigmented red Measures 7" long Sold individually Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter

pencils.title: Semi-Hex 498 #1 Pencil
pencils.description: This pencil is a nostalgic but currently manufactured version of the classic American yellow pencil. Family-owned General Pencil Company has been making pencils in Jersey City, NJ since 1889 and is one of only three pencil companies still left in the United States. All of their pencils are made of high quality California incense cedar and are made to as high a standard as they were 100 years ago. The Semi-Hex is the pencil we consider to be the most classic American pencil still in production. It used to be recognized by its distinctive purple band around its ferrule and for the colonial scene depicted on its box. The name comes from the subtlety of its shape--though hexagonal, the edges on the hex are softened. These features may not be quite the same anymore, it's still the pencil we use most as a benchmark for comparison in quality and graphite hardness. Now rendered in paint, these "ferrules" are inspired by pre-World War II designs, attaching a bit of history to the modern pencil. Made in Denmark Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7" long Sold in a sleeve of three, one of each color Round barrel, normal diameter Unsharpened Note: this pencil does not have an eraser on them

One of the great things about Viarco is that they're always looking to innovate but also aren't afraid the raid their archives for forgotten gems of decades past. pencils.title: Vintage Collection - 1950
pencils.description: Founded in Portugal in 1907, Viarco is one of the finest (and smallest) pencil factories currently operating in Europe. Each product is made traditionally with an immense amount of care and this collection is a beautiful testament to that. Viarco has made perfect reproductions of some of their pencils made between 1940 and 1960 with details so exact you'd never know they're recently manufactured. Even down to the way the packaging opens and the exact typography--they're the perfect gift for any pencil nostalgist or collector but can also be trusted as fine writing instruments as they always have been. pencils.title: Violet 272 Copying Pencil
pencils.description: Copying pencils were first introduced in the 1870s as a form of ‘ink’ pencil that couldn’t be erased. They had violet aniline dye in the core that can transfer when wetted and pressed against another piece of paper. They were most used during WWI as a way to write, sign and make copies of documents quickly and easily as the only other permanent option at the time was a fountain pen, which was messy and more difficult to carry around. Though the aniline dyes originally used have since proven to be toxic, a small number of pencil companies still make contemporary versions. The core in this one is a classic copying pencil purple and is non-toxic. Viarco is Portugal's one and only pencil factory. Founded in 1907, Viarco has done a beautiful job of preserving and sharing their Portuguese while also constantly innovating unique new things. They are very much a 21st century pencil company. pencils.title: Anthracite Perfect Pencil Magnum 2
pencils.description: The Graf von Faber-Castell Perfect Pencil is the most luxurious and complete pencil experience. The fluted California cedar pencil comes with a capped eraser on one end, and a combination point-protector, pocket clip, and sharpener on the other. Both the pencil and the eraser can be replaced (keep in mind that the cap will only fit on Graf von Faber-Castell pencil refills). The high-quality graphite and anthracite PVD coated titanium hardware make this the Perfect tool for those who write, draw, or simply enjoy fine analog tools. This particular version is a jumbo version of F-C's original Perfect Pencil and features an extra thick 2B lead. Prior to the 20th century, the famous pencil firm went by the name A.W Faber until heiress Baroness Ottilie von Faber married Count Alexander zu Castell-Rüdenhausen. They legally changed their last names to Faber-Castell in order to use it as the new name for the family business. The Graf von Faber-Castell line (translated literally as the Count of Faber-Castell) celebrates the tradition and history of this esteemed company. Made in Germany Measures 6 inches assembled Pencil measures 5 1/4 inches Cap measures 3 inches Sold individually This set comes with 1 pencil. You can find the appropriately sized refills here. pencils.title: Blackwing 602 Pencils (Dozen) 2
pencils.description: The classic! This pencil was made famous by the smoothness of its graphite, its unique eraser clamp and the famous faces who wrote with it. Here we have a reproduction made by Palomino, and it's pretty darn close to the original. The Blackwing 602 was originally made by Eberhard Faber in New York. It was introduced in the early 20th century and was lauded for the uniqueness of its design and its quality as a writing pencil. When Eberhard Faber was sold in 1988 the Blackwing survived for only a couple of years before it was discontinued. Luckily, Palomino acquired the rights to the pencil only a couple of decades later and brought the legacy of the Blackwing 602 to light for a new generation of pencil users. pencils.title: Blackwing Volume 10001 Pencils 2
pencils.description: The Summer 2018 Blackwing Volumes release is naturally beautiful, features a unique pentagonal shape and has a particularly interesting background story. As the box reads: "When Tetsuya Miyamoto invented the KenKen® puzzle in his mathematics classroom in 2004, his goal was to improve his students’ problem solving and logic skills. He describes his method as “The Art of Teaching without Teaching,” and his dream is to make the world smarter with his invention. Today, the KenKen® puzzle is the only puzzle printed daily alongside the New York Times Crossword. Puzzles like these inspire us to apply problem solving and logic in creative ways, letting our minds perform a beautiful dance between their left and right hemispheres. Blackwing 10001 (壱万壱) pays tribute to Miyamoto Sensei’s puzzles and other creative ways of teaching and learning. 10001 is a numeral palindrome in Kanji as well as in Arabic numerals. It is also tied to one of Miyamoto Sensei’s favorite equations. The pencil features a red stained barrel, gold imprint and unique five-sided “Gōkaku pencil” shape. Translated literally from Japanese, Gōkaku means “passed,” as in a problem or exam. It is also a near-homophone for the Japanese word “Gokakukei,” meaning pentagon. Gōkaku pencils are given to every student who graduates from the Miyamoto Mathematics class." Made in Japan from California cedar Grade: Ungraded but feels a B or even a 2B (same hardness as a Blackwing 602) Replacement erasers are available here Each pencil measures 8" long Pentagonal barrel, normal diameter Sold by the dozen

pencils.title: Blackwing Volume 33 1/3 Pencil - Dozen 2
pencils.description: The autumn edition of the ever-popular Blackwing Volumes series is a tribute to another popular analog relic: the vinyl record! Here's the story, from the source: " From their introduction in the late 1800s, analog records have withstood the advent of radio, the rise and fall of CDs and MP3s, and the dawn of streaming. Rather than be displaced by these more convenient ways of consuming music, the vinyl record has instead shifted from an object of convenience to one of connection. And it has thrived in the process. Just as the way we engage with pencils and notebooks is different from the way we interact with keyboards and touch screens, the way we engage with records is different from the way we interact with digital music. From the rich, uncompressed sound to the album art and liner notes, records tell a story both physically and sonically. According to music icon Henry Rollins, of all the ways to listen to music, “vinyl [best] represents what the musicians wanted you to hear.” The vinyl experience not only creates a physical and emotional connection between music and people, it creates a connection between musicians and their fans. The Blackwing 33 1/3 is a tribute to vinyl records. It features a matte black finish and matte black ferrule to go with its black imprint and black eraser. The gloss black foil banding near the grip was inspired by the grooves on a record." Made in Japan from California cedar Grade: Ungraded but feels like a 2B (the same core as the Blackwing Pearl) Replacement erasers are available here Each pencil measures 8" long Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Sold by the dozen

pencils.title: Blackwing Volume 4 Pencil - Dozen 2
pencils.description: Meet the winter 2018/2019 edition of the Blackwing Volumes series! This one has a unique texture, a colored ferrule and a great story, straight from the source: "In 2020, NASA will send a rover to Mars to search for evidence of ancient Martian life while testing technologies for future human expeditions. While the engineering designs for the rover and its various instruments are finalized in CAD, its revolutionary robotic arm and zoom-enabled cameras – the first of their kind to be sent to another planet – were first conceptualized in drawings by the team at Motiv Space Systems using Blackwing pencils. Earlier this year, Motiv delivered their assemblies based on these drawings to begin integration onto the rover. In 2020, they will join the Wright brothers’ wrapping paper sketches and Katherine Johnson’s brilliant calculations as examples of the pencil’s ability to help us reach the sky, space and beyond. The Blackwing 4 is a tribute to Mars and the upcoming rover mission. It features a rust-colored lacquer and sand-textured finish inspired by the surface of the fourth planet. It also features our first ever bronze ferrule, a cream imprint and eraser, and our soft graphite." Made in Japan from California cedar Grade: Ungraded but feels like a 3B-ish (the same core as the black Blackwing) Replacement erasers are available here Each pencil measures 8" long Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Sold by the dozen

Prior to the 20th century, the famous pencil firm went by the name A.W Faber until heiress Baroness Ottilie von Faber married Count Alexander zu Castell-Rüdenhausen. They legally changed their last names to Faber-Castell in order to use it as the new name for the family business. The Castell 9000 is the hallmark of the pencil giant's shift into a new century. Made in Germany Grade: #2/HB, runs hard, feels more like an F or H. pencils.title: Futura #2 Pencil 2
pencils.description: As far as vintage pencils go, there's one that always at the top of our eBay wish list. The Futura was first made in the 1950s by Richard Best Pencil Company--the same pencil company that made the first triangular pencil, the Try-Rex. The Futura was their snazzy pink version of their flagship pencil, with its wonderful typography and often flashy ferrule. The Futura existed in a few slightly different forms during its existence and is still a highly sought after vintage. Somewhere along the line J.R Moon of Lewisburg, Tennessee acquired the rights to the Try-Rex and the rest of Richard Best's companies so we approached them about bringing our favorite Futura back in a modern way. Though the ability to do a super custom ferrule is limited these days and the odd shaped printing plate necessary for the beveled ages is just short of impossible, we hope you enjoy our 2017 version of this glossy pink beauty. Made in the USA Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7 1/2" long Sold individually Triangular barrel, normal diameter We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. Founded in 1917, Gekkoso is a special place because they sell only house-made products, and this is their one and only pencil. pencils.description: This pencil is understated and totally underrated. As Mitsu-bishi's standard writing pencil (officially designated for 'General Writing'), this green beauty has terrific point retention and a well finished end. In the first half of the 20th century, Japanese pencils were labeled with their intended use because of regulations set to monitor the prices pencils were being sold for. Pencils designated for certain uses were meant to have certain characteristics and qualities that were consistent with other brands and reflected in their price. Though this isn't used anymore, the inclusion of the designations is still included in most pencil designs. pencils.title: Hardtmuth 1500 Pencil - 2B 2
pencils.description: In 1889, the Koh-i-Noor 1500 pencil made its grand debut at the World's Fair in Paris. At this moment in history most radical innovations debuted similarly but for the pencil industry this was especially monumental. Not only was the 1500 the first pencil to be painted yellow but it was also the first pencil to be deliberately painted as a design choice. Painting a pencil normally signified that the pencil was imperfect and there was something to hide so makers of high quality pencils opted to leave them unpainted to show of the wood grain. Originally the ends were dipped in 24ct gold, they came in an unheard of 17 grades and were sold for at least three times that of comparable pencils of its time. Over a century later, the Koh-i-Noor Hardtmuth 1500 is still manufactured similarly to how it was in the 1880s and represents an undeniably important moment in pencil history. Made in the Czech Republic Grade: 2B but feels more like a B or an HB Measures 7" long Sold individually Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter Pre-sharpened We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. The swatch in this product listing reflects that.

pencils.title: Mephisto 73B Copying Pencil - Hard 2
pencils.description: The copying pencil is an excellent example of a specialty pencil from a bygone era. It was originally made to contain vibrant purple aniline dye, so that it could be used for permanent marking and also to be transferrable when wet. The height of its popularity was in the very early 1900s when it served as an easy, permanent writing tool and as a way to copy documents. The Mephisto was one of the most popular models in the US during this era--this version is a purple of with a hard lead, which is generally preferable for copying pencils. Note: since this pencil was produced, aniline dye has been found to be quite toxic. It's absolutely safe to use the pencil for its intended purpose, just be sure you don't ingest it. pencils.description: Mitsubishi Pencil Company was founded in 1887, and this is their oldest still-manufactured pencil. The 9800 has long been Mitsubishi's starter-level multi-grad writing pencil though it's anything but ordinary. It's marked as being for general writing though we think it's great for drawing too. In Japan not all writing pencils are expected to be a #2/HB as many favor softer pencils like this one. In the first half of the 20th century, Japanese pencils were labeled with their intended use because of regulations set to monitor the prices pencils were being sold for. Pencils designated for certain uses were meant to have certain characteristics and qualities that were consistent with other brands and reflected in their price. Though this isn't used anymore, the inclusion of the designations is still included in most pencil designs. pencils.title: Mono 100 Pencil - 2B 2
pencils.description: The Tombow Mono 100 pencil came to be in 1967 when it made its debut as the brand's new, highest quality pencil in its popular Mono product line. It was designed by famed Japanese designer Takashi Kono with its signature white stripe over the end, untarnished gold accents and blindingly shiny lacquer. All of that aside, what makes it especially unique is its smoothness--it contains a whopping 10 billion particles per cubic millimeter in its graphite core. Though originally made for drawing, we love this pencil as an extra-premium option for writing as well. They run a little bit soft but have excellent point retention. Made in Vietnam Grade: 2B, runs about 1 grade soft Measures 7" long Sold individually Hexagonal barrel, normal diameter We measure the characteristics of the pencils we sell against a General's Semi-Hex #2, which is the pencil we consider to be a good quality pencil of true HB/#2 hardness, similar to that of most American #2 pencils. pencils.title: Potent Copying 749 Pencil 2
pencils.description: The copying pencil is an excellent example of a specialty pencil from a bygone era. It was originally made to contain vibrant purple aniline dye, so that it could be used for permanent marking and also to be transferrable when wet. The height of its popularity was in the very early 1900s when it served as an easy, permanent writing tool and as a way to copy documents. This later example comes with its own little cap to prevent an inky mess and contains red dye. According to the text on the back of the pencil, it's meant "for hectograph use". Note: since this pencil was produced, aniline dye has been found to be quite toxic. It's absolutely safe to use the pencil for its intended purpose, just be sure you don't ingest it. Vintage: 1960s Made in the USA Measures 8" long Hexagonal barrel Please note that all vintage pencils may have minor flaws due to age and that you can expect the erasers to not work anymore. The pencil you will receive will not necessarily be the one in the photo but definitely one from the same dozen. We've tried our best to accurately capture the quality of the pencil and promise not to sell you something of lesser quality. For Blackwings especially, the ferrules were rarely put on straight. Please do not be alarmed if your ferrule isn't aligned with the text, it won't affect the function or value of the pencil.

The pencils only came in 12 colors and were renowned for being the favorite colored pencil among animators and architects in Japan. Their hard, highly pigmented lead was preferred to fine line drawing. Panic ensued and stores very quickly sold out of every color. Within 24 hours, Mitsubishi decided to continue making the four most popular colors: red, orange, yellow-green and light blue. Here you’ll find the red version, the most coveted of them all. Whether you’re grading papers, sketching around or making a master plan, it’s an excellent addition to your pencil arsenal. The Semi-Hex is the pencil we consider to be the most classic American pencil still in production. It used to be recognized by its distinctive purple band around its ferrule and for the colonial scene depicted on its box. The name comes from the subtlety of its shape--though hexagonal, the edges on the hex are softened. These features may not be quite the same anymore, it's still the pencil we use most as a benchmark for comparison in quality and graphite hardness. It's made by Kita-boshi, a small family owned pencil company in Japan. Kita-boshi is not only known for their pencils but also for recycling the by-products of pencil making for other innovative products and for their commitment to sustainability and education. They are very much a 21st century pencil company. One of the great things about Viarco is that they're always looking to innovate but also aren't afraid the raid their archives for forgotten gems of decades past. These pencils are part of their collection of vintage prints that they've brought back. Made in Portugal Grade: a true #2/HB Measures 7 1/2" long Round barrel, normal diameter Sold individually or in a sleeve of three

pencils.title: Vintage Collection - 1950 2
pencils.description: Founded in Portugal in 1907, Viarco is one of the finest (and smallest) pencil factories currently operating in Europe. Each product is made traditionally with an immense amount of care and this collection is a beautiful testament to that. Viarco has made perfect reproductions of some of their pencils made between 1940 and 1960 with details so exact you'd never know they're recently manufactured. Even down to the way the packaging opens and the exact typography--they're the perfect gift for any pencil nostalgist or collector but can also be trusted as fine writing instruments as they always have been. pencils.title: Violet 272 Copying Pencil 2
pencils.description: Copying pencils were first introduced in the 1870s as a form of ‘ink’ pencil that couldn’t be erased. They had violet aniline dye in the core that can transfer when wetted and pressed against another piece of paper. They were most used during WWI as a way to write, sign and make copies of documents quickly and easily as the only other permanent option at the time was a fountain pen, which was messy and more difficult to carry around. Though the aniline dyes originally used have since proven to be toxic, a small number of pencil companies still make contemporary versions. The core in this one is a classic copying pencil purple and is non-toxic. Viarco is Portugal's one and only pencil factory. Founded in 1907, Viarco has done a beautiful job of preserving and sharing their Portuguese while also constantly innovating unique new things. They are very much a 21st century pencil company.
